intro: Psychotria marcgravii f. minor, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a compact shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green in color. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This species is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically along forest floors or in understory layers.
